title.narrative: Support to vulnerable communities and conflict sensitive reintegration efforts in Northeast Nigeria – Phase II

description.narrative: 5,060 beneficiaries (targeting 50% men and 50% women) Output 1: Capacity building for Local Leaders in Conflict Resolution and Peacebuilding • 100 leaders reached over 5 trainings Output 2A: Support to women and girls and their families associated with JAS • 1,600 women and girls reached over 40 workshops Output 2B: Small-scale Initiatives for women and girls and children born of sexual violence • 5 Small-scale Initiatives for 500 women and girls and children born of sexual violence Output 2C: Community leader-led Support sessions for families • 800 family members reached over 40 workshops Output 4A: Support to communities to increase social cohesion through intra-community dialogues • 1,600 community members reached over 40 workshops Output 4B: Support to communities to increase social cohesion through inter-community dialogues • 960 community members reached over 24 workshops

OUTCOME: Reintegration of conflict affected people in their communities of origin across Borno State supports reconciliation and healing and it is conflict sensitive OUTPUT 1: Community and religious leaders are equipped to understand and address challenges to social reintegration at the intra- and inter-community level in IDP camps as well as in host communities and communities of origin OUTPUT 2: Peacebuilding initiatives provide displaced and conflict affected communities and families with the capacity to generate debate around social cohesion and return of displaced people, supporting reintegration and understanding radicalisation from a local perspective.
